remarks: A Dirichlet character is a monoid homomorphism from the multiplicative monoid on ` Z/nZ ` to the multiplicative monoid of ` CC ` , which is zero off the group of units of ` Z/nZ ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2016.)
statement:
dchrval.g $e |- G = ( DChr ` N ) $.
dchrval.z $e |- Z = ( Z/nZ ` N ) $.
dchrval.b $e |- B = ( Base ` Z ) $.
dchrval.u $e |- U = ( Unit ` Z ) $.
dchrval.n $e |- ( ph -> N e. NN ) $.
dchrbas.b $e |- D = ( Base ` G ) $.
dchrelbasd.1 $e |- ( k = x -> X = A ) $.
dchrelbasd.2 $e |- ( k = y -> X = C ) $.
dchrelbasd.3 $e |- ( k = ( x ( .r ` Z ) y ) -> X = E ) $.
dchrelbasd.4 $e |- ( k = ( 1r ` Z ) -> X = Y ) $.
dchrelbasd.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. U ) -> X e. CC ) $.
dchrelbasd.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. U /\ y e. U ) ) -> E = ( A x. C ) ) $.
dchrelbasd.7 $e |- ( ph -> Y = 1 ) $.
dchrelbasd $p |- ( ph -> ( k e. B |-> if ( k e. U , X , 0 ) ) e. D ) $.
$d A k $.
$d B k x y $.
$d C k $.
$d E k $.
$d N x $.
$d U k x y $.
$d X x y $.
$d Y k $.
$d Z k x y $.
$d k ph x y $.
